msContents.summary: Drafts of 3 letters written by Eukles: the first is about the price of pottery and sale of wine; the second was addressed to Anosis, the village scribe of Philadelphia, angrily charging him that he had been careless and dishonest so that the state had incurred some losses: in the future his accounts were going to be checked; the third letter is addressed to Dionysios about the same accounts of Anosis

msItemStruct.note: 35 lines written along the fibers in a small, neat hand, perhaps Eukles' himself; there are corrections and words written over the line
Written on the other side of P.Col. IV 87 and at a later time

There are two paragraphoi (and not 1 as in the edition): one separates the second from the third letter and one at the end; the first letter is separated by a large space and probably by another paragraphos which is not visible any more

physDesc.p: 1papyrus fragment, broken at top ; 12 x 30 cm
